message.content: So instead of the main LLM flow after the recursive language model, what I want you to do is stop the animation with the blue dot shrunk. That's all for now.
Nice! When it finishes, what I want you to make now is when I click the blue dot, it expands into four subnodes. Each one is a team, and when I click the subnode, it expands again on engineers.
Very nice. Like two more things: - Where are the lines between the nodes? That's important, and I don't want them expanded by default. - I want them to shrink when I click it again
Database front-end machine learning and backend. Those are the teams that I want you to hard code, please. And then change The color of the dots of the team is white.
Please allow me to expand two team nodes at the same time after the recursive language model call ends.

Just a final check at the same number of nodes that it was initially on the recursive language model step, please. I think it was way more. Check the dashboard folder that is on the. I'll send you the path. /Users/fabioroma/Code/ultracontext/dashboard
Wait, I pulled the code from the repo to check why the dashboard function isn't working anymore. Actually, check this out first.
no, i mean the dashboard inside agentsync
Comid push.

Hey, what I want you to do is while the query is happening, when I asked the MCP to figure out what the team is working on, I want you to show the dashboard. We actually don't need a show dashboard function. We only needed the query context. Just show the dashboard, whatever, don't remove any piece of shit.
go ahead
Just to be clear, the first thing is you open the dashboard, then you run the query, then you return the data on the main text window, and keep the dashboard open. I want to interact with the widget.

Please remove the `show_dashboard` function and merge the functionality inside the `query`. So the way it should work is when we call the `query` it should first open the dashboard and then do the query on the same like a single step.

So when the recursive part of the graph stops, what I want you to do is for each theme instead of hardcoding, I want you to go in the folder themes and actually figure it out what are the current themes and for each one you display a node.
I want you to wait for the RLM animation to finish to then return the textual response. Please make sure you wait.
Do you think it's really possible to wait for the RLM to finish before returning the text response?
Okay, so pull up the MCP apps docs and figure this out. It's important for us to wait for the animation to finish before returning the text response.
here is the docs. i need the animation to finish before returning stream https://modelcontextprotocol.io/extensions/apps/overview
Update the teams and the people with the current folder. Tell me if it's dynamic or hard-coded.
Ok, so git commit push
